fields.description: Any user or visitor can go to a team's profile and click on Members to see the individual members.  This is a definite blocker for business users who pay for private repositories.  On other repository management sites, you can make a user's membership into a team private, BitBucket does not have this feature.  This seems fairly trivial and hopefully is easy to implement.

Hi Bitbucket team,

I use the source browser quite often when I search something in the histories of files in my repositories. You did a very good job with it.

However, I would not only like to view my files, but I would also like to be able to download a file I found interesting. Currently, I have to help myself creating a new file and copying the content, but this is not exactly great user experience.\\
I guess this feature would be very easy for you to add since you already extract the file from the code repository to display it.

Thanks in advance!
See [BB-8625|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-8625]
fields.summary: Bonus user invites don't work when creating an account via social registration (BB-8625)

fields.description: The "Our other git tools" link to "http://www.atlassian.com/git" is broken on the Bitbucket nav footer.

Would be great to have an option to select multiple components.

p.s. It appears that I need Tags rather than Components.
See [BB-8622|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-8622]
fields.summary: Stripping changesets produces a 'pushed' event in the newsfeed instead of stripped incorrectly (BB-8622)

fields.description:
I need setting default .hgignore for new repos, created at bitbucket.org.

For example, by creating repo i can mark a checkbox "include default .hgignore", and it will added automatically in included initial commit.

This is to reduce the number of the same manual steps in creating the repository, for example, to exclude *.pyc files from the processing of about Python, etc.

Currently everyonce participating in a code review gets emailed every comment right away and there's no way of knowing if there are more comments coming up or if the collaborator is done reviewing.

It would be nice if there was an option to hold the comments and send them out all at once when the reviewer selects it or when a certain time period has passed.\\
If this is implemented it might make sense to send the comments in a single mail.

Working with IDE on 1/2 of screen and browser in other on a standard HD 1920x1080 screen, all site options are visible except the Log In button.  Site layout designed 1024 width maximum for legacy screens, which is ok.  Suggest moving Log In button to be visible at 800 width or variable width.
fields.summary: Log In Button Obscurred in 1920x1080 1/2 screen (BB-8621)

fields.description:
I used to work well before, but today suddenly I cannot pull. It always reports: connection reset by peer.

Strange thing is some offices work, but some not.

* Sydney of Australia: work
* Shanghai of China: not work
* New York of US: not work

I not not sure who to assign. But it's really really blocking!!!

Follow these steps to recreate the issue:

* Make a commit whose name consists of all number
* Push it
* Go to Overview page\\
The commit name appears to be a link. When click, it redirects to 404 page.
fields.summary: Commit name consists of all number appear to be a link; clicking redirects to 404

fields.description: With the current settings, it seems public wiki can be changed by anyone.  And private wiki is visible only to users with access right.  We should have a public but read-only wiki option in the middle.

fields.summary: Users without access to the from repo cannot be added as a reviewer to a Pull request (BB-8619)

fields.description:
Hi,

I really like the PR reviewer system, but sometimes in a large collaboration it is tricky to determine who might be relevant for a particular PR.  It would be great if Bitbucket could suggest reviewers based on the lines of code that were changed and who the last previous author was -- something that could be done manually using hg blame -u on each changed file but would take a lot of time.

Thanks for all the great improvements recently!

Unsubscribe from commit emails for this repository gives a 404

This is from the footer of a commit notification email
fields.summary: Unsubscribe from commit emails for this repository gives a 404

fields.description:
I've migrated my project "alembic" to git, and in so doing I renamed the old project to "alembic_moved_from_hg_to_git", created a new project "alembic", and added the code, as well as the full issue database from the old project using the [importer tool|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Export%2Bor%2BImport%2BIssue%2BData].

But all the "watchers" were lost, even though the watchers are in the db-1.0.json file.  I had to personally click the "watch" link for all the issues myself, and there is not even an easy way I can send a message to all the previous "watchers" that the issues have all been moved, except for sending a message to all 64 of them individually (a prospect I'm not excited about).

There needs to be some way to get the watchers onto a new tracker once an issue import is performed, either allowing them to go in directly or at least some system of notifying them.
fields.summary: issue importer does not transfer watchers on homegrown-zips

fields.description:
When committing code (via git in my case) one should be able to reference an issue via its hash ID. This also affects closing of issues which already works but gives no notice which commit closed it.

Every mention of an issue via commit notice should be reflected as comment in the issue itself so one can easily jump to the commit when viewing an issue.
fields.summary: Reference commits into issues as comments

fields.description:
This is a repeat of this [issue|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/4330/code-embedded-into-other-sites-missing].

This was resolved at one point but appears to be broken again.  Not sure how to re-open a previously resolved issue?
fields.summary: Code embedded into other sites missing syntax highlighting

fields.description:
This isn't a new issue.  The issues list changed quite a while ago, but I still dislike it.

The old issue tracker was clean, uniform, uncluttered, and easy to scan.  I liked the fact that each issue took up the same amount of vertical space and the font was large enough to be readable but small enough to maximize the space in terms of number of listings displayed.

Then everything changed and it's a pain every time I use it.  The font is bigger and the issue titles are broken into multiple lines.  (Scaling the font size in my browser hasn't helped.)  The grey component tags just clutter that space further, making it difficult to read.  There are at least six different colors in there.  The graphics are not quite conventional enough to be obvious, which makes them more distracting than informative.  All in all, there's less information there and it's much harder to scan through it quickly and find what I need.
fields.summary: Old issues list was more legible

fields.description:
I uninstalled Git, re-installed the latest version. setup ssh followed [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Set+up+SSH+for+Git|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Set%2Bup%2BSSH%2Bfor%2BGit]

But there are some errors. Anyone can help?

I have docs repo in my bitbucket

{code}
$ git clone git@bitbucket.org:nickleefly/docs.git
Cloning into 'docs'...
ssh_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{code}

Below is some information

{code}
#!shell

$ ssh -v git@bitbucket.org
OpenSSH_4.6p1, OpenSSL 0.9.8e 23 Feb 2007
debug1: Reading configuration data /c/Users/asus/.ssh/config
debug1: Applying options for bitbucket.org

debug1: connect to address 207.223.240.182 port 22: Attempt to connect timed out
 without establishing a connection
debug1: Connecting to bitbucket.org [207.223.240.181] port 22.
debug1: Connection established.
debug1: identity file /c/Users/asus/.ssh/id_rsa type 1
debug1: Remote protocol version 2.0, remote software version OpenSSH_5.3
debug1: match: OpenSSH_5.3 pat OpenSSH*
debug1: Enabling compatibility mode for protocol 2.0
debug1: Local version string SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_4.6
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEXINIT sent
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEXINIT received
debug1: kex: server->client aes128-cbc hmac-md5 none
debug1: kex: client->server aes128-cbc hmac-md5 none
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_REQUEST(1024<1024<8192) sent
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_GROUP
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_INIT sent
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_REPLY
debug1: Host 'bitbucket.org' is known and matches the RSA host key.
debug1: Found key in /c/Users/asus/.ssh/known_hosts:1
debug1: ssh_rsa_verify: signature correct
debug1: SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS sent
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS
debug1: SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS received
debug1: SSH2_MSG_SERVICE_REQUEST sent
Read from socket failed: The connection was aborted
{code}

then I added

{code}
Host bitbucket.org
 IdentityFile ~/.ssh/id_rsa
 Port 443
{code}

into {{~\.ssh\config}} file\\
then

{code}
#!shell
$ ssh -v git@bitbucket.org
OpenSSH_4.6p1, OpenSSL 0.9.8e 23 Feb 2007
debug1: Reading configuration data /c/Users/asus/.ssh/config
debug1: Applying options for bitbucket.org
debug1: Connecting to bitbucket.org [207.223.240.182] port 443.
debug1: Connection established.
debug1: identity file /c/Users/asus/.ssh/id_rsa type 1
ssh_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host
{code}

{{~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub}} had been added into my account/ ssh`

when i run {{ssh-add -l}}\\
the output is the following\\
{{Could not open a connection to your authentication agent.}}

Deleting messages in BitBucket causes them to automatically disappear. This can be problematic if you delete a message by accident.

It would be great if deleted messages could be moved to a "Trash" folder that was periodically emptied and confirmation was required before deleting messages.

Hi! When I'm using my custom domain, my repository download page cannot upload a new file... I always get a message like this: MalformedPOSTRequest The body of your POST request is not well-formed multipart/form-data. FDBA2F41A53D9C5D GYEowj98CakbZietYsbExEZ06ncLUFGovlZ0nEI7erMiE72QAzi0SVGyHOsHOV9U Tks!
fields.summary: Upload file when custom domain is configured

fields.description:
There's some useful information on the home page. Strangely, once I am signed in, I can't get to it.

It seems pretty standard to have a "Home" link anywhere on a site, and there is one at the top of my dashboard review. But it takes me right back to dashboard review. The status bar says the link is

https://bitbucket.org

but this is false advertising! It is actually turned into

https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview

Give me a link for the home page. Then, give me a link for my dashboard, that's great. Put it in big purple neon letters if you like. But don't take away my ability to do something as simple as navigate to the site's home page.
fields.summary: It's impossible to view the Bitbucket home page without signing out (BB-8614)

fields.description:
This is probably not something one would normally do but when done, it causes a problem:

Mac OS 10.6 (snow leopard)\\
Python 2.7 (apple default)

mg = ModuleGraph()\\
mg.run_script('/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/unittest/*init*.py')

produces AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'identifier'

Call stack is\\
run_script\\
scan_code\\
_safe_import_hook\\
import_hook\\
find_head_package
fields.summary: Python error in find_head_package on run_script of unittest/__init__.py

fields.description: Please see the image attached. This is happening with all my repositories on an up-to-date Chrome (26.0.1410.63) running on Ubuntu.

I'm trying to create a Markdown wiki and got a hard time creating friendly links between my pages and files. Noticeable problems I've found:

* Markup like {{[Authentication]}} does not link automatically to my Authentication.md file, and I have to write something like {{[Authentication](Authentication)}} what sounds somewhat redundant.
* There are several help pages explaining how amazing it is to link files, commits and changesets in a wiki, but none of those explain that the syntax is only for Creole wikis. Also, there's no example on those pages (what would help people notice the markup is Creole-only). You can even see by the comments that there's a lot of people facing the same issues I had, and there's no comment helping back.
* Additionally, those Creole extensions should be expanded to cover the other file formats as well.
fields.summary: Wiki documentation and feature support on link markups is very poor

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to set the language for the project to LilyPond, and more importantly, be able to view LilyPond files with helpful syntax highlighting instead of the default.

Those not familiar with LilyPond can learn about it here: http://lilypond.org/text-input.html
fields.summary: LilyPond syntax highlighting and project language (BB-8626)

fields.description: When I made a change with the online editor, it seemed service integration hooks were not executed.
fields.summary: Online editor does not fire events for hg repositories (BB-8735)

fields.description:
In its current implementation, Bitbucket allows a user to follow (i.e. receive email updates) individual pull requests, issues, and wikis piecemeal.  Alternatively, one can follow an entire repository and thus intrinsically follow all pull requests, issues, and wiki changes associated with that repository.

What I would like is to be able to follow a repository so that I follow new PRs, issues, and so on by default, but I'd like the ability to "unfollow" individual pull requests and issues within that repository.

The reason I ask this, is that I'm involved in a very active development repository.  I want to be aware of new PRs and issues as they crop up.  However, many of the PRs and issues are not related to my work, and I don't necessarily need to know everything associated with all of them.  When some of my co-developers get going, they can generate long and high-cadence comment streams discussing PRs and issues that end up flooding my mailbox.  As I said, I don't mind if this is on an area of the code with which I'm interested, but if it is unrelated to my work, I'd just as soon ignore these emails.

Is it possible to implement an "unfollow" button for individual PRs / issues inside of a repo that we're following?
fields.summary: Unfollowing PRs/issues associated with repositories that a user *is* following. (BB-8609)

fields.description: Since we can configure multiple email addresses in our account settings, it would be useful for us to be able to subscribe to a certain repository with a certain email addresses. For example, I have work repositories and personal repositories associated with my Bitbucket account. I would like all emails from my work repositories (issues, commits, pull requests etc.) to be sent to my work address and all emails from my personal repositories to be sent to my personal address. For the time being, you can use the mailing list feature for issues to get new issue notifications for a repository, but it looks to be limited to that alone, unfortunately.
fields.summary: For users with multiple email addresses, allow address selection on a per-repository basis

fields.description: As we can now edit files directly in bitbucket, why we couldn't be able to tag code from source view (any branch)? This would be really great feature.
The green Box behind the fields is too small

I am trying to push my changes to master branch by the below command

git push -u origin master

But nothing is happening I waited for around 2 hours and tried the same in n number of times. Please let me know the way to fix this issue

fields.summary: The text editor is losing line breaks

fields.description:
FishEye shows with every changeset the comment and a list of files changed in the changeset. This is very helpful - I can easily see what part of the system a changeset is about without having to click to find out.

It can be a simple UI option to view "exapanded" view of the list of commits in the source browser.
fields.summary: View list of files changed in the commits list (BB-8608)

fields.description: When using the edit commit button on BitBucket to edit a pull request or committed file, the original permissions of the file are lost this was noticed when editing a Pull Request, the permissions on an alert script where changed from 100755 to 100644 (executable to non-executable)

Hi,

it would be nice if we were able to download individual files from a repository in a compressed format. Compression should be done on-the-fly (and probably only be enabled for small files). A way this could be implemented is by adding\\
additional "LZMA" / "GZIP" / "BZIP2" buttons next to the "Raw" button\\
on the file source view. These buttons should link to

https://bitbucket.org/sschuberth/mingwgitdevenv/lzma/<sha1>/<filename>\\
https://bitbucket.org/sschuberth/mingwgitdevenv/gzip/<sha1>/<filename>\\
https://bitbucket.org/sschuberth/mingwgitdevenv/bzip2/<sha1>/<filename>

respectively. Pressing such a button should compress that file\\
on-the-fly on the server and send it to the web browser under a name\\
like <filename>.lzma (or ".gzip" / ".bzip2" appended respectively).\\
This would help to not host compressed representations of files\\
separately in the download section. Note that as only single files get\\
compressed in this use case they should not be wrapped into a TAR\\
before compression.

To me, especially LZMA on-the-file compression would be very useful.
fields.summary: In addition to "Raw", allow to download files on-the-fly compressed

fields.description: We also don't receive a commit e-mail from the e-mail service for these commits.
fields.summary: Commits made via the web editor do not show up in activity or dashboard

fields.description:
In a Mercurial repository, you cannot see if a file was renamed ({{hg rename}}) or if the old name was deleted and the new added ({{hg add; hg remove}}). It is as if Bitbucket runs Mercurial with {{diff.git = true}} in the config file.

An example of a rename is [8fb8dce3f9b6|https://bitbucket.org/mirror/mercurial/commits/8fb8dce3f9b6]  in Mercurial's repository. The {{test-config-case.t}} file was renamed to {{test-config.t}}, but this cannot be seen. This makes it practically impossible to review changesets involving renames.

Running {{hg serve --config diff.git=true}} shows how one can do it instead by adding "rename from tests/test-config-case.t" and "rename to tests/test-config.t" lines above the diff. I'm sure you can come up with something nice here :-)

For copies, it is only the new file that shows up in the diff on Bitbucket, as seen for [5c5152af0d15|https://bitbucket.org/mirror/mercurial/commits/5c5152af0d15] where {{map-cmdline.phases}} was copied from {{map-cmdline.defaults}}.
fields.summary: Renamed and copies not shown on commit page

fields.description: See [undefined|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/undefined]
I would use bitbucket rather than GitHub, but Sourcetree breaks my projects.  It tweaks with the packages and their orientation.

Hi.\\ Ich bekomme folgende Fehler, hängt es wirklich von Version ab? 'url' requires a non-empty first argument. The syntax changed in Django 1.5, see the docs.\\ 1 {% if user.is_authenticated %}\\ 2

Hallo {{ user.username }}!\\ 3 Passwort ändern\\ 4 Logout

\\ 5 {% else %}\\ 6

Login\\ 7 Registrieren

\\ 8 {% endif %}\\ 9
fields.summary: 'url' requires a non-empty first argument. The syntax changed in Django 1.5, see the docs
File diff view should show hunk context (BB-8603)

fields.description:
Following Markdown code {{# 2013/15/5 23:00}} produces following HTML-Output {{

2013155-2300">2013/15/5 23:00

}} which produces the following Text output: {{2013155-2300">2013/15/5 23:00}}.\\ Expected output is {{2013/15/5 23:00}}.
fields.summary: Wiki weird output for date entered in header in Markdown

fields.description:
We have the following pull requests that have all been merged into the target branch, but Bitbucket has not closed them:

* https://bitbucket.org/metabrainz/musicbrainz-server/pull-request/146/mbs-6213-permit-isrcs-starting-with-tc
* https://bitbucket.org/metabrainz/musicbrainz-server/pull-request/186/mbs-6271-construct-correct-cdtoc
* https://bitbucket.org/metabrainz/musicbrainz-server/pull-request/189/mbs-6295-track-identifier-related-changes
* https://bitbucket.org/metabrainz/musicbrainz-server/pull-request/187/mbs-6293-update-ws-1-track-lookup-by-puid
* https://bitbucket.org/metabrainz/musicbrainz-server/pull-request/181/fix-ws-2-json-tests
* https://bitbucket.org/metabrainz/musicbrainz-server/pull-request/184/check-release-events-without-a-country

fields.description:
I created a private c++ repository called 'compiler++'. Since that is not a valid URL name, the url becomes 'jakoblaegdsmand/compiler'. When redirected to this page i just see "Please while we setup your repository" and this page refreshed every 5 seconds or so. It just hangs here. It seems that an error happened and the repo never got created.

The problem is that i don't to the menu of this repository, so I can't remove it.
fields.summary: Creating site with character '+' in title results in failure

fields.description:
Save issue's list sorting option (see attachment) after page refresh.

To reproduce:

# Choose a sorting option
# Edit random ticket
# Return to issues list - wrong sorting.
fields.summary: Save issue's list sorting option after page refresh (BB-8600)

fields.description: Add "save advanced filter" feature to the issue tracker

I'm working on a Mac and still have files that use CR instead of LF as line separators.\\
It appears that your diff viewer can't handle this and sees such text files as one big line.

See here, for example:

https://bitbucket.org/garrypettet/fgscopebar/pull-request/1/retina-support-and-a-few-minor-fixes/diff\\
E.g, the "demo app/FGScopeBar Components/FGScopeBar.rbbas" file, which is a text file. A screenshot is attached as well.
fields.summary: Diff Viewer in Pull Request does not handle CR as line separator correctly

I am currently experiencing a significant delay in the POST service called after a push to a project.  This is typically almost instant, where as I'm seeing delays of 3 - 5 minutes after a push before the POST request is issued.

Is this a known issue or temporary performance delay?

Hi guys

Could you either:

a) *turn off* case-sensitive matching on the regex you use to look for commands like "fix BCLOUD-123" so a commit message of "Fix for BCLOUD-123" will resolve the bug

or

b) update the wiki page to highlight the fact that commands must be in lowercase/are case sensitive https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Automatically+Resolving+Issues+when+Users+Push+Code

Cheers!
fields.summary: Re "Automatically Resolving Issues When Users Push Code"

fields.description:
If you make a search for owner/repository on the public homepage you don't see any results. It just says you that there are some results but without really showing them on the result pages.

See also screenshot.

Tested with: Firefox, Opera
fields.summary: Public search for owner/repository doesn't show results

fields.description:
# Open bitbucket
# Enter some word, e.g. test in the search line. Press enter
# It shows that there is around 7000 results, but no way to select any of them

Please see attach.

When editing my account, I input "http://www.diogin.com/" to the "Website" option, then look my profile, it shows as "http://diogin.com/".

This is wrong.
fields.summary: Lost "www" in "Website" option in account setting

fields.description:
When editing the wiki, if you switch to "preview" mode, the button changes its label to "Edit". At this point there are two buttons labeled "Edit" on the screen. One will switch you back to edit mode. The other will throw all your work away.

I realize it should be easy to tell them apart, but if you're moving too fast, it's really easy to hit the wrong one.

Possible solutions:

* Make the pressed "Edit" toggle button do nothing when clicked (already editing!)
* Relabel one
fields.summary: Easy to lose wiki work by pressing wrong "Edit" button

fields.description: I have been using the Issue Tracker for one of my projects. I am used to using expensive trackers in funded business settings, and one thing I am sorely missing is the ability to set a bug status as "Claim Fixed/Resolved", so that the original tester can go back and test to see if the bug has actually been resolved. This creates a great dynamic, where bugs are not just marked Resolved, but they are earmarked to be re-tested before being Resolved.
See [BB-8591|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-8591]
fields.summary: support vim and emacs keybindings in online editor (BB-8591)

fields.description: See [BB-8589|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-8589]
fields.summary: use bookmarks or anonymous heads for branching in hg with online editor (BB-8589)

fields.description:
Hi support,

I am currently experiencing the issue that I am unable to delete messages in my bitbucket inbox. Neither the delete button in the inbox, nor the button in the message view work. Same is true for the 'mark as unread' button.\\
Messages are still marked as read when I open them and return to the inbox.

I am using Internet Explorer 10 on Windows 8 x64 and the issue occurs in both, the metro and the desktop version of it. Until recently, I was able to delete messages on exactly the same system. I must add, that I have the feeling, that the site became less responsive.

Thanks in advance,

Michael

You can contact support or create a public issue if the problem persists.\\
This might be useful in debugging the problem:\\
659ffbebc5d14446a70669e6d4aa0ada

Tested on Firefox and Chrome, OS is Windows 8 64 Bit

There is an information disclosure vulnerability present in BitBucket 38a1a76297f0 / 9a539a797f36.

A bitbucket team that has a public list of members but private repositories will never show the repositories on the team page and the page will never show the number of private repositories on that team.

However, through a member's individual profile (on their own bitbucket page), their memberships to teams lists the number of repositories belonging to each team, even if those teams have all repositories marked as private.

example (sorry to pick on you, Matt):\\
https://bitbucket.org/MattCampbell/

Platforms like Google App Engine have deprecated OAuth1 but support some flavours of Oauth2.

Supporting OAuth2 would add value.

When I'm revoking MY access from other user repository, I'm getting email notification which says "(deleted user) revoked your access to the repository:". I think that instead of (deleted user) my login/name should be placed
fields.summary: Invalid email notification when revoking access

fields.description:
Hi There

Two imports from our svn repo have failed halfway through. The result is a 'dead' repository on bitbucket's side that i'm unable to delete. When trying to access them I get "An error has occurred." or 404 if I manually try get to their settings.

How would I go about removing these repositories from out account?\\
BB-Pricecheck\\
BB-Pricecheck2

Regards,\\
CJ
fields.summary: Failed import from svn x2 (can't delete broken project)

fields.description: Can Bitbucket be changed to have a tab on both team accounts and regular accounts to track how many commits were made from that account? I really like this feature on GitHub that shows your contributions, and an activity graph. It also tells your current commit streak, and the longest streak you've done. It gives me kind of a feeling of success if I can see the number of commits I've made. I'm not sure if you'd want to implement this and scan for all the commits people have already made, or just start from now on, it doesn't really matter to me though. I just want this feature.

spent the time to follow the poor ondemand to bitbucket instructions..  got the authors all setup and that part worked..

now I have these "unmapped" users in GIT.. with no "click to invite" user or anything else that's easy to resolve the situation..  nor can I find anything to bulk invite a list of users to the team..

If this isn't automatic (why not?) this should at least be a lot easier to add users as part of the ondemand to bitbucket transition

We are a team consist of two developers and we've created a private repository  ,I've made a few commits from my account, and when I check the repository page under the *Recent activity* section I can see the commits made by my account, but when I open the commits tab, the commits appear to be made by the other developer's account
fields.summary: made commits from my account but appears to be commited from another account

fields.description:
When pushing to a bitbucket git repository via ssh i randomly see output from the remote that seems to be ACL related:

{code}
#!bash

 Counting objects: 19, done.
    Delta compression using up to 2 threads.
    Compressing objects: 100% (10/10), done.
    Writing objects: 100% (10/10), 931 bytes, done.
    Total 10 (delta 7), reused 0 (delta 0)
    remote: R IS: <GroupResult: 7dd5fe5c-d3b1-4d7e-9faf-4957a9474bac [d27b9bd2-3f77-4f5a-8c69-89bc96029e8c, 9be4e76b-4349-48d9-a2f5-5b29d17c528b, 9b3f7bfa-cec8-44f3-91f8-716390fdb13e, 8c2c6d76-8e20-4eae-8e24-ab99a6d34d3b, 151a3a87-484f-47a5-b12e-9f17732096a5]>

{code}

This maybe leaks out UUID of your ACL System.
fields.summary: UUID ACL Output on git push

fields.description:
Hi

I'm using Fedora and trying to clone my repository (using the 'git clone' link provided by Bitbucket) and have been shown the message "Cloning into my_folder_name...'' for a while now so I'm guessing it's broken somewhere. Would you be able to clarify what might be going wrong here?

Anna
"I have an existing project to push up" is not translated: "Es existiert Code, den ich importieren möchte"

"read_only" is always false, no matter weather if user's privilege is read/write/admin.

And It should be a more informational as privilege then just just "read_only" to tell difference between write and admin. Now Bitbucket has no API for user to know what kind privilege he/she have. This is a critical bug.

I tried to import my code for https://sourceforge.net/p/ucomponents/ and received confirmation that the repositery was imported.

"The remote Mercurial import you started for http://ucomponents.hg.sourceforge.net:8000/hgroot/ucomponents has completed successfully."

However nothing was imported. The URL that bitbucket attempted to import from "http://ucomponents.hg.sourceforge.net/hgweb/ucomponents" appears to have no code. A web interface for mercurial is however available at "http://hg.code.sf.net/p/ucomponents/code"

By bypassing the restrictions for the import field and putting in "http://hg.code.sf.net/p/ucomponents/code" instead of the default "http://ucomponents.hg.sourceforge.net:8000/hgroot/ucomponents" I was able to successfully import the project.

Please consider:

* making the input field editable by default,
* checkin if the repository is empty and warn about it.
* automatically determining where to import from

We have a repository with a number of read only users. However, these users appear to be able to edit and decline pull requests. The only difference between a user with commit access and a user without commit access appears to be the ability to merge. This seems counter-intuitive.

I would expect read only users to be able to approve of a pull request, comment on a pull request and edit/decline their own pull requests. I would not expect a read only user to be able to edit or decline other users pull requests.

Some additional information:

* The repository was a transfer from a user account to a newly created bitbucket team
* The team is listed as the owner of the repository
* The users have been added as members to the bitbucket team with read only access
* The users are also listed as read only access on the specific repositories access management page
* The overview page of the repository shows read permissions for the user
fields.summary: Read Only Users Can Decline and Edit Pull Requests from Other Users

fields.description:
I can not clone my deposit on my own computer, the error is\\
% Hg clone - verbose - hg clone https://luciole135 @ bitbucket.org/luciole135/dailystat\\
repository hg clone https://luciole135 @ bitbucket.org/luciole135/dailystat not found\\
[command returned code 255 Sun May 12 9:24:42 2013]

{{content_rendered}} field used to have links to changesets (hash) and issues (#{number}) in relative format starting with {{/}} and there was missing only {{https://bitbucket.org}} prefix. Now you have added a new prefix {{https://api.bitbucket.org/}} to these links even though they are not valid API links, e.g. they lack {{1.0/}}. It seems that you only need to remove {{api.}} subdomain from them.
fields.summary: API: Dead links in Changeset Comments resource (BB-8599)

fields.description: I've had my programs leaked before, because someone downloaded the branch and recompiled it.  Could you add it so you could disable that?
fields.summary: Add ability to disable downloading a branch? (BB-8598)

Using gravatar for an avatar these days is completely stupid.  Why do I need a Wordpress account to upload a photo of myself?

Yesterday, I made myself a fork of GNU Octave via https://bitbucket.org/repo/import. The official GNU Octave repository is located at http://www.octave.org/hg/octave.

The import proceeded just fine. However, when I attempt to clone the repository from BitBucket onto my personal machine, this is what happens:

{code}
#!bash
$ hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/vote539/octave octave
requesting all changes
adding changesets
adding manifests
adding file changes
added 16634 changesets with 103919 changes to 11925 files (+1 heads)
updating to branch default
remote: conq: repository does not exist.	abort: no suitable response from remote hg!

$ hg clone https://vote539@bitbucket.org/vote539/octave octave
requesting all changes
adding changesets
adding manifests
adding file changes
added 16634 changesets with 103919 changes to 11925 files (+1 heads)
updating to branch default
cloning subrepo gnulib-hg from https://vote539@bitbucket.org/vote539/octave/gnulib-hg
requesting all changes
adding changesets
adding manifests
adding file changes
added 16634 changesets with 103919 changes to 11925 files (+1 heads)
abort: unknown revision '5a51fb7777a9950502965a043a70bd6ca5e0498b'!
{code}

Since the last command only breaks down when it tries to clone the subrepo "gnulib-hg", I suspect that this may be the cause of the issue, but I am unsure.

My fork of the repo is at: https://bitbucket.org/vote539/octave

I prioritized the issue as "Blocker" because it is indeed blocking my development work.

Thanks for looking into this!
Is there any way to retrieve a ZIP Archive of a particular repository via the REST APIs?
I want to add one avatar
